                                Chemistry

                                Higher level

                                  Paper 3

must not be reproduced or distributed to any other person without the
authorization of the IB Global Centre, Cardiff.
                                                                          –3–                                    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

                                                                     Section A

     Question                                       Answers                                                      Notes                    Total
1.     a           0.5
                «        100 »  2 «%»                                                                                                   1
                  25.0
1.     b        pipette/pipet «rather than a measuring cylinder»                                Accept using a burette/buret.
                                                                                                 Accept using a volumetric/measuring
                                                                                                 flask.                                    1
                                                                                                 Do not accept “use of a more precise
                                                                                                 measuring cylinder”.


2.     a        more «moles/amount» of acid have been added/reacted
                OR
                more of the limiting reagent is present                                                                                    1
                OR
                more «of the exothermic» reaction has occurred ü
2.     b        no more reaction/same energy released AND cold/colder/cooler liquid added        Accept “no more reaction/same energy
                OR                                                                               released AND greater heat loss «to
                no more reaction/same energy released AND greater total volume of liquid        the surroundings in mixture D»”.          1




3.              volume «found by extrapolation of the two best fit lines» required to give the   Accept “where lines through the points
                highest temperature                                                              meet”.
                OR                                                                               Accept “at maximum temperature”.          1
                extrapolate «two best fit» lines to the point where they meet                   Accept “at 35 cm3 of HCl”.
                                                                          –4–                                        M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

     Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                      Total
4.              graph would peak/maximum at 17.5 cm3                                               Accept “graph would peak at a smaller
                OR                                                                                 volume” for M1.
                half/smaller volume of acid «to reach equivalence»                               Accept “gradient/slope «of graph» is
                                                                                                   greater/steeper” for M1.                    2 max
                sulfuric acid is dibasic/diprotic 
                higher temperature would be reached 
                                                                                                   Accept “1 mol sulfuric acid neutralizes 2
                
                                                                                                   mol of sodium hydroxide” for M2.



     Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                      Total
5.     a        heat change/evolved can be calculated from the «maximum» temperature
                increase and the mass of solution
                OR
                q  mcT 

                heat «evolved» gives the number of moles «of both acid and alkali present when
                neutralisation occurs»
                OR
                       q                                                                                                                       2 max
                n           
                     H neut

                volume «of acid and the volume of alkali required to just neutralise each other»
                can be used to calculate the concentration«s of both»
                OR
                           n
                [NaOH]      
                           V
5.     b        smaller temperature increase/T
                OR
                heat released would «appear to» be less                                                                                         2

                amount of substance/n «calculated is » smaller 
                                                                  –5–                                      M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

5.   c   using «expanded» polystyrene cup                                               Accept any other reasonable
         OR                                                                             suggestion.
         insulating beaker                                                              Do not accept “calorimeter” by itself.      1
         OR
         putting a lid on beaker 
5.   d   «specific» heat capacity of the beaker/container/thermometer is ignored        Accept “reaction goes to completion”.
         OR                                                                             Accept “reaction is conducted under
         density of the solutions is assumed as 1.00 g cm3/same as water               standard conditions”.
         OR                                                                             Accept “no evaporation occurs”.
                                                                                                                                    1
         specific heat capacity of the solutions is assumed as 4.18 J g1 K1/same as   Accept any other relevant valid
         water                                                                         assumption.
                                                                                        Do not accept “heat is not released
                                                                                        from other reactions”.
5.   e   allows simple theories to be applied to real life situations
         OR                                                                             Accept “errors do not have a major
         enables us to start to understand complex situations                           impact on the results”.
         OR                                                                             Do not accept “to simplify the situation”   1
         gives answers that are accurate to the required order of magnitude             without further detail.
         OR
         simplifies the calculations involved 
5.   f   temperature rise would be too small «to be accurately measured»               Accept “heat released would be too
                                                                                                                                    1
                                                                                        small «to be accurately measured»”.

                                                                    Section B
Option A — Materials

    Question                                           Answers                                                   Notes                     Total
 6.   a          polar covalent 
                 average electronegativity « 1 (3.0  2.0)»  2.5 AND electronegativity                                                    2
                                              2
                 difference « 3.0  2.0»  1.0 
 6.    b         ionic bonding
                 OR
                 electrostatic forces between ions 

                 «slight» movement brings ions of same charge adjacent to each other «causing                                               2
                 the crystal to break»
                 OR
                 «slight» movement results in repulsion between layers «causing the crystal to
                 break» 


 7.    a         too high/higher than carbon in the reactivity series                            Accept “lanthanum is more reactive
                 OR                                                                              than carbon”.
                 carbon/C is a weaker reducing agent than lanthanum/La                          Accept “lanthanum is a weaker              1
                                                                                                 oxidizing agent than carbon”.
                                                                                                 Accept converse arguments.
 7.    b                               1000 g                                                    Award [3] for “578 «A»” (from premature
                 amount of La «                 »  7.20 «mol»                                 rounding) or “579 «A»”.
                                   138.91gmol1
                 Q « 7.20 mol  3  96 500 C mol1»  2.08  106 «C»                                                                      3
                      2.08  106 C
                 I «              ›  579 «A» 
                        60  60s
                                                                    –7–                                         M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

   Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                     Total
8.   a        twelve/12                                                                                                                    1
8.   b        «moving» electron attracts «nearby» positive charges/ions/cations 
              creates «local» regions of increased positive charge 
              positive charge/field attracts second electron «with opposite spin» 
              two electrons form a Cooper pair                                                                                           3 max
              «all» Cooper pairs «in sample» interact/form «electron» condensate 
              «electron» condensate/Cooper pairs move/flow «through sample» freely/without
              resistance 
8.   c        reduces the band gap to zero
              OR                                                                                                                            1
              «at high temperatures» thermal motion disrupts the formation of Cooper pairs 


9.   a        Repeating unit:                                                                  Continuation bonds necessary for the
                 O                             O                                               mark.
                                                                                               Accept alternative repeating unit with O
                      C                    C                                                  at other end.
                                                                                               Do not penalize square brackets or n.        2
                  O                            O    CH2   CH2       
              
              Other product: water/H2O 
9.   b        condensation                                                                    Accept polyester or thermoplastic.           1
9.   c        combine with reactants to form «a temporary» activated complex/intermediate
              OR                                                                                                                            1
              consumed in one reaction/step AND regenerated in a later reaction/step 
9.   d        can modify/improve the catalyst/reaction «by making logical predictions»         Accept other reasonable, relevant
              OR                                                                               answers.
                                                                                                                                            1
              science relies on models to understand physical reality                         Accept “to predict/select the ideal
                                                                                               catalyst for a reaction”.
                                                                          –8–                    M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                       Answers                                         Notes                Total
10. a        electrons AND positive ions «in gaseous state»                    Accept “gas” instead of “argon”.
             high frequency/alternating current passed through argon
             OR
                                                                                                                        2
             «oscillating» electromagnetic/magnetic field
             OR
             high frequency radiowaves 
10.   b      Ksp  [Sb3]2.[S2]3                                              Award [3] for correct final answer.
             [Sb3]2. (1014)3  1.6  1093                                                                           3
                                     51
             [Sb3] «    1.6  10         »  4.0  1026 «mol dm3» 
10.   c      EDTA/ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid                              Accept “EDTA4”.
             OR                                                                 Accept other chelating agents.          1
             H2NCH2CH2HN2/ethane-1,2-diamine 
                                                                    –9–                                        M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                      Answers                                                       Notes                    Total
11. a          A RIC: 1 AND B RIC: 4 

               ALTERNATIVE 1:                                                                For either, accept specific frequencies
               «only» PETE contains carbonyl/CO/ester/COO groups                           in these ranges (eg 1735 «cm1 » or
               carbonyl groups absorb at 1700–1750 «cm1 »                                  2900 «cm1»).                              3

               ALTERNATIVE 2:
               LDPE contains more CH bonds «than PETE» 
               CH bonds absorb at 2850–3090 «cm1 » 
11.   b   i    HDPE less branched                                                            Accept “no branching in HDPE AND
               OR                                                                            branching in LDPE”.                        1
               LDPE more branched 
11.   b   ii   HDPE «polymer» chains/molecules can pack together more closely «than LDPE     Accept converse arguments.
               chains»
               OR
               HDPE «polymer» chains/molecules have a higher contact surface area «than
               LDPE chains» ü                                                                                                           2

               stronger intermolecular/dispersion/London/van der Waals’ forces in HDPE AND
               higher melting point ü
                                                                      – 10 –                               M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

Option B — Biochemistry

   Question                                       Answers                                                  Notes                Total
 12. a    i     «water/aqueous solubility depends on forming many» H-bonds with water ü

                raffinose has many hydroxyl/OH/oxygen atoms/O «and forms many H-bonds»                                           2
                AND linoleic acid has few/one hydroxyl/OH/oxygen atom/O/carboxyl group/   Accept statement which implies
                COOH/is largely non-polar «and cannot form many H-bonds» ü                 comparison.
 12.   a   ii   «base» hydrolysis/saponification                                           Accept condensed formulas.
                OR                                                                         Accept non-balanced equation.
                «produces glycerol and» soap/salt of the «fatty» acid                     Accept “RCOONa”.




                                                                                                                                2 max
                                                                                      




                «products are» water soluble «and drain away» 
 12.   b        linoleic acid/C18H32O2 combustion/oxidation more exothermic «per mol»     Accept converse arguments.

                                                                                                                                  2
                linoleic acid/C18H32O2 has lower proportion/number of O atoms
                OR
                linoleic acid/C18H32O2 is less oxidized 
                                                                     – 11 –                                  M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                       Answers                                                     Notes                     Total
13. a    i                                                                                  All OH groups must be on the same
                                                                                            side.
                                                                                            Accept structures with chiral carbon
                                                                                            atoms shown as C or C* instead of
                                                                                           crosses.                                    1




13.   a   ii                                                                                Accept –O– in a straight line provided
                                                                                            both Hs are above the plane.


                                                                                                                                       1




13.   b        «allow» 3-D perspective of structures «of cyclic monosaccharide molecules»
               OR
               «show» cis/same side arrangement of «attached» groups
               OR                                                                                                                       1
               «show» trans/opposite side arrangement of «attached» groups
               OR
               «make» carbon and hydrogen implicit 
13.   c   i    abundant/renewable/allows use of «local» vegetation                          Do not accept answers related to
               OR                                                                           biodegradable examples.
               less use of fossil fuel/oil based plastics                                   Ignore any reference to cost.
               OR                                                                           Accept “carbon neutral/do not contribute    1
               air permeable/better breathing of products                                   to global warming”.
               OR                                                                           Accept “require less energy to produce”.
               «can be» mixed/blended with synthetic polymers                              Accept “do not produce toxic products”.
13.   c   ii   HOCH(CH3)COOH/CH3CH(OH)COOH                                               Do not accept C3H6O3.
                                                                                                                                        1
                                                                                            Do not accept OH-CH(CH3)-COOH.

  Question                                        Answers                                                          Notes                       Total
14. a         catabolism/catabolic                                                                                                             1
14. b    i    alanine                                                                            Do not accept Ala.                            1
14. b    ii   Lys/lysine 

              pH «buffer»  pI «Lys»                                                              Do not apply ECF from M1.
              OR
              buffer more acidic than Lys «at isoelectric point»                                  Accept converse arguments.
              OR
                                                                                                  Do not accept just “has H3N group” for       2
              «Lys» exists as                                                                     M2 (as H3N is also present in
                                                                                                  zwitterion).
                                                                                                  Do not penalize if –COOH is given in
              OR                                                                                  the structure of lysine at pH 6 instead of
              «Lys» charged positively/has 1/1 «overall» charge «and moves to negative          –COO–.
              electrode» 
14.   c       highest frequency of successful collisions between active site and substrate        Accept “number of collisions per unit
              OR                                                                                  time” for “frequency”.
              highest frequency of collisions between active site and substrate with sufficient
              energy/E  Ea AND correct orientation/conformation                                  Do not accept "all active sites are
                                                                                                                                                1
              OR                                                                                  occupied".
              optimal shape/conformation of the active site «that matches the substrate»
              OR
              best ability of the active site to bind «to the substrate» 
14.   d       ascorbic acid/vitamin C                                                                                                          1
14.   e       react/bind/chelate with enzyme                                                      Do not accept “changes shape of active
              OR                                                                                  site” by itself.
              disrupt ionic salt bridges
              OR
              affect shape of tertiary/quaternary structures                                                                                    1
              OR
              precipitate enzymes
              OR
              break/disrupt disulfide bridges/bonds 

  Question                                       Answers                                        Notes                    Total
15. a        «pH range» 8.6–10.6                                               Accept any value between 8.2 and 11.0.    1
                                    3
15. b        «Km » 0.67 «mmol dm »                                            Do not penalize if a graph is drawn to
                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                determine the value.
15.   c      does not compete for active site
             OR
             binds to allosteric site/away from «enzyme» active site
             OR                                                                                                           2
             alters shape of enzyme 

             reduces rate/Vmax 
15.   d      « cytosine   guanine  100   17   17   66 »
             Cytosine: 33 «» AND Guanine: 33 «»                                                                        2
             Thymine: 17 «» 
                                                                            – 14 –                         M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                          Answers                                                Notes                 Total
16. a          binding of O2 «to one active site» affects shape of Hb/other active sites
               OR
               binding of one O2 «molecule» affects binding of other O2 «molecules» 

               increasing affinity of Hb to O2                                                                                    2
               OR
               enhanced binding of «further» O2 «molecules»
               OR
               cooperative binding 
16.   b   i




                                                                                                                                  1




               sketching right shift of curve on graph 
16.   b   ii   decreases «oxygen saturation»                                              Accept “hemoglobin binds to O2 with
                                                                                                                                  1
                                                                                           less affinity".


17.            11-trans retinal no longer fits into the rhodopsin/protein
               OR
               11-trans retinal is ejected from the rhodopsin/protein 
                                                                                                                                  2
               leads to conformational change in rhodopsin/protein «to opsin generating
               signals» 

Option C — Energy

   Question                                        Answers                                                   Notes                    Total
 18. a          presence of dark/absorption lines corresponding to those found for carbon   Accept “presence of characteristic dark
                OR                                                                          lines”.
                                                                                                                                        1
                missing wavelengths/frequencies corresponding to carbon’s spectrum         Do not accept responses in terms of
                                                                                            emission spectra.
 18.   b   i    8
                4   Be                                                                                                                 1
 18.   b   ii   loss in mass  «8.005305 amu  4.002603 amu  12.000000 amu »              Award [3] for correct final answer.
                0.007908 «amu» 
                                                                                                                                        3
                 «0.007908 amu  1.66  1027 kg amu1 » 1.313  1029 «kg» 
                E  «mc2  1.313  1029 kg  (3.00  108 m s1)2 » 1.18  1012 «J» 
 18.   c        fuel more abundant/cheaper 
                no «long half-life» radioisotopes/radioactive waste                        Do not accept simply “fusion produces
                shipment of radioactive fuels not required                                 more energy than fission”.
                                                                                                                                      2 max
                plutonium/nuclear weapons cannot be produced from products 
                nuclear disasters less likely «as no critical mass of fuel required» 
                higher specific energy/energy per g/kg/unit mass than fission 


 19.   a        delocalized bonding/conjugated bonds 
                contain metal atom/ion coordinated to «organic» ligand(s)                                                            2 max
                involve bonds from nitrogen to the central metal ion 
 19.   b        I3  2e  3I                                                            Accept I2  2 e  2I.                     1

  Question                                     Answers                                                  Notes                      Total
20. a        methanol
             OR
             ethanol                                                                 Accept alcohol.
                                                                                                                                    2
             strong acid
             OR                                                                       Accept any specific strong acid or
             strong base                                                             strong base other than HNO3/nitric acid.
20.   b      CH3(CH2)16COOCH3 / CH3OCO(CH2)16CH3                                      Product must correspond to alcohol
             OR                                                                       chosen in (a), but award mark for either      1
             CH3(CH2)16COOC2H5 / C2H5OCO(CH2)16CH3                                   structure if neither given for (a).
20.   c                          12000kJmol1                                         Award [1] if both are in terms of a unit
             Specific energy «                 »  40.1 «kJ g1»                    other than kJ (such as J or MJ).
                                  299 gmol1                                                                                        2
             Energy density « 40.1 kJ g1  0.850 g cm3»  34.1 «kJ cm3» 


21.   a      heat/react with «oxygen and» water/steam                               M1 requires concept of heat.
             C + H2O  CO + H2
             OR
             3C  O2  H2O  H2  3CO
                                                                                                                                    2
             OR
             2C  O2  2CO AND C  H2O  H2  CO
             OR
             C  O2  CO2 AND C  CO2  2CO AND C  H2O  H2  CO 
21.   b      «Fischer-Tropsch» catalytic reduction of carbon monoxide with hydrogen   If equation is given for a specific alkane
             OR                                                                       or alkene, it must be a liquid (n>4).
             (2n1) H2  n CO  CnH(2n2)  n H2O
             OR                                                                                                                     1
             reduction of carbon monoxide to methanol and catalytic dehydration
             OR
             2H2  CO  CH3OH AND n CH3OH  CnH2n  n H2O 
                                                                       – 17 –                                  M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                         Answers                                                    Notes                      Total
22. a          Anode:     CH3OH (aq)  H2O (l)  CO2 (aq)  6H (aq)  6e                  Accept correctly balanced equations
               Cathode:   O2 (aq)  4H (aq)  4e  2H2O (l)                               with multiples of the coefficients given
               Overall:   2CH3OH (aq)  3O2 (g)  2CO2 (aq)  4H2O (l)                      here.                                        3
                                                                                             Accept reversible or non-reversible
                                                                                             arrows for all.
22.   b   i    «portable» sources of electrical energy/electricity
               OR                                                                                                                         1
               convert chemical «potential» energy to electrical energy/electricity 
22.   b   ii   primary cells involve irreversible reactions AND rechargeable cells involve   Accept “primary cells have a limited life
               reversible reactions                                                         before going ‘flat’ AND rechargeable         1
                                                                                             cells can be recharged when ‘flat’”.
22.   c        Voltage:                                                                      Accept temperature for either but not
               chemical nature of electrodes                                                 both.
               OR                                                                            Accept concentration for either but not
               electrode reactions                                                          both.
                                                                                             Accept pH for either but not both.           2
               Current:
               diffusion rate
               OR                                                                            Accept the current depends on the
               internal resistance/resistance of the cell                                  area/separation of the electrodes.
                                                                    – 18 –                                     M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                      Total
23. a        computers can now carry out more complex calculations                           Accept “better/faster computers”.
             OR                                                                              Accept “better modelling”.
             better understanding of the interactions between the various systems involved   Accept “better/more reliable/consistent
             OR                                                                              data”.
             clear evidence of global warming                                                Accept “better measuring techniques”.
             OR                                                                              Accept other scientifically based (not
                                                                                                                                           1
             «reliable» global temperature data now available                                politically based) reasons.
             OR                                                                              Accept if specific relevant data is given.
             techniques have been available to monitor carbon dioxide levels 
                                                                                             Do not accept “increased combustion of
                                                                                             fossil fuels” or “increased concerns
                                                                                             about global warming”.
23.   b      symmetric stretching will not absorb IR
             OR
                                                                                                                                           2
             asymmetric stretching will absorb IR 
             change in polarity/dipole «moment» required «to absorb IR» 
23.   c      CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H (aq)  HCO3 (aq) «and pH decreases»                    Accept reversible or non-reversible
                                                                                             arrows for all.
             OR
                                                                                                                                           1
             CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)  H2CO3 (aq) AND H2CO3 (aq)  H (aq)  HCO3 (aq)
             «and pH decreases» 
23.   d      reduce it AND absorbing/reflecting sunlight                                    Accept “reduce it because of global
                                                                                             dimming”.
                                                                                                                                           1
                                                                                             Accept “reduce it AND blocking
                                                                                             sunlight”.
                                                                         – 19 –                                      M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

Option D — Medicinal chemistry

   Question                                         Answers                                                          Notes                       Total
 24. a           «measures» therapeutic window/margin «of a drug»                                   Accept “difference between
                 OR                                                                                 ED50/minimum effective/therapeutic
                 range of doses that produce a therapeutic effect without causing toxic effects    dose «for 50  of population» AND
                                                                                                    TD50 /toxic dose «for 50  of
                                                                                                                                                   1
                                                                                                    population»”.
                                                                                                    Do not accept “therapeutic index”.
                                                                                                    Do not accept lethal/fatal dose as this is
                                                                                                    not LD50.
 24.   b         work directly on opioid/pain receptors «in brain»                                 Do not award mark for “resemble
                 suppress pain impulses in brain/CNS                                               hormones”.
                                                                                                                                                 2 max
                 resemble endorphins/enkephalins/natural chemical painkillers «produced in the
                 brain and spinal cord» 
                                                                       – 20 –                                        M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

  Question                                    Answers                                                                Notes                     Total
25. a        presence of «large» benzene/arene ring AND non-polar/hydrophobic                       Accept “phenyl” for “benzene ring”.
             OR
             presence of «large» benzene/arene ring AND cannot form H-bond with water              Accept "carboxylic acid" for "carboxyl".

             contain –COOH/carboxyl/OH/hydroxyl «and ester group» AND                              Do not accept "alcohol" for hydroxyl".       2
             polar/hydrophilic
             OR
             contain –COOH/carboxyl/OH/hydroxyl «and ester group» AND can form H-
             bonds with water 
25.   b      «student’s» sample impure                                                             Accept converse statements.

             crystal lattice disrupted/not uniform «due to presence of impurities»
                                                                                                                                                 2
             OR
             fewer interparticle/intermolecular forces «due to presence of impurities» 

25.   c      One similarity:
             peak at 2500–3000 «cm1»/ peak due to OH/hydroxyl in carboxylic acids
             OR
             peak at 1700–1750 «cm1»/ peak due to CO/carbonyl
             OR                                                                                     Accept peak at 1600 cm1 for arene/
             peak at 2850–3090 «cm1»/ peak due to CH of arene                                    benzene ring – not in the data booklet.

             One difference:                                                                                                                     2
             peak at 3200–3600 «cm1» in salicylic acid/ peak due to OH in phenol in
             salicylic acid                                                                         Accept “2500–3600 cm1 «overlapping
             OR                                                                                     absorptions of two OH» in salicylic
             «two» peaks at 1700–1750 «cm1» in aspirin AND one peak «in the same area»             acid”.
             in salicylic acid                                                                     Accept “stronger/broader/split peak at
                                                                                                    1700–1750 cm1 in aspirin”.
25.   d      dissolve compounds in an organic solvent                                              Accept organic solvents immiscible with
             add NaOH(aq)/OH−(aq) «to the mixture» to convert aspirin to its water soluble salt    water such as hexane, ethyl ethanoate,
             separate the two «immiscible» layers                                                  butyl acetate.                             3 max
             convert salt «in aqueous layer» back to aspirin by reacting with acid/H              Accept any other base.
             «evaporate solvents and dry»                                                           Need explanation for mark.
                                                                 – 21 –                       M17/4/CHEMI/HP3/ENG/TZ1/XX/M

25.   e   «use of» alternative solvents such as supercritical/liquid CO2    Do not accept political/regulatory
          OR                                                                solutions.
          use of water «as solvent»
          OR
          solvent-free reactions «for example, polymerization of propene»
          OR
          solid-state chemistry                                                                                      1
          OR
          recycle «waste» solvents
          OR
          catalysis that leads to better/higher yield
          OR                                                                “catalysis” not sufficient for mark.
          reducing number of steps 

26. a                            [HCO3  ] 
             « pH  pKa  log10              6.34  log10 11.2  6.34  1.05 »  7.39                                                  1
                                 [CO2 ] 
26.   b      H from aspirin reacts with HCO3− to form CO2 and H2O                             No mark for “stating aspirin is a weak
             OR                                                                                acid that dissociates partially to produce
             H (aq)  HCO3 (aq)  CO2 (aq)  H2O (l)                                         H” without reference to reaction with
                                                                                               HCO3 or to the equation.
             OR                                                                                                                              2
                                                                                               Reversible arrows not required for the
             reverse reaction favoured «to use up some of the H added» 
                                                                                               mark.
             pH decreases                                                                     Do not accept “small pH change when
                                                                                               small amount of H is added”.

  Question                                       Answers                                                           Notes                     Total
27. a        «drug» blocks/inhibits «viral» enzyme/neuraminidase/NA «activity» 
                                                                                                                                              2
             prevents virus from leaving/escaping host cells «thus cannot infect other cells» 
27.   b      ALTERNATIVE 1:                                                                       Do not accept “planting more Chinese
             «using» genetically modified/GM E. Coli/bacteria/microorganisms                     star anise” or other plant sources of
                                                                                                  shikimic acid.
             E. Coli/bacteria biosynthesis
             OR
             E. Coli/bacteria «overfed by glucose» undergo fermentation
             OR                                                                                                                               2
             cells of the bacteria «are broken down to» form precursor/shikimic acid 

             ALTERNATIVE 2:
             use readily available cyclic ester/lactone 
             forms «the correct stereoisomer of oseltamivir» in a shorter number of chemical
             steps 
27.   c      «can develop antibiotic» resistance in bacteria/microorganisms                       Accept secondary effects, such as
             OR                                                                                   reduced biodiversity of aquatic/soil
             changes in microbial/bacterial population                                           ecosystems, denitrification of soil (due
                                                                                                  to decline in nitrogen-fixing bacteria).
                                                                                                                                              1
                                                                                                  No mark for just stating “water
                                                                                                  contamination”.
                                                                                                  No mark for just stating “failure of
                                                                                                  aquatic/marine environment”.

28. a        plane of polarization is rotated                                    Award zero if answer refers to
                                                                                                                          1
                                                                                  plane-polarized light being bent.
28.   b      not a racemic mixture
             OR
             two enantiomers not equimolar
             OR                                                                                                           1
             mixture contains optically active impurity
             OR
             relative proportions of enantiomers in mixture can be determined 

               OR

               beta-radiation/emission AND produces «small amount of» gamma-rays «for
               visualizing tumours/monitoring treatment» 
29.   c   i           ln 2    0.693
               λ (                  )  8.64  102 / 0.0864 «day1» 
                       t1    8.02 day                                                                                              1
                       2

29.   c   ii   ALTERNATIVE 1:
               «N0  initial amount  100 »
               N « 100  90»  10  at time t 
                     100 
               « ln        2.303  0.0864t »
                     10 
                          2.303
               «t                    » 26.7 «days»                                   Accept 26.6 or 27 «days»
                       0.0864 day 1                                                    Award [2] for correct final answer.

               ALTERNATIVE 2:                                                                                                      2
               «Nt  N0(0.5)n where n  number of half-lives»
               10  100(0.5)n 
                      1
               « log    n  log0.5 »
                      10 
                                            1
               « 1  n  0.301 / n          »
                                          0.301
                        1                                                               Accept 26.7 or 27 «days»
               «t           8.02  » 26.6 «days»                                     Award [2] for correct final answer.

29.   d        Anode (negative electrode): C2H5OH  H2O  CH3COOH  4H  4e 

               Cathode (positive electrode): O2  4H  4e  2H2O 
